result.execSummary:
The defendant Brendan S. Schauer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The forfeiture and costs shall be paid directly to the Taylor County Clerk of Court at the rate of $30.00 a month beginning October 18, 2022. Failure to pay may result in a civil judgment being entered against you, tax intercept, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.  Defendant's bond of $150.00 has been applied towards the forfeiture and costs.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brendan S. Schauer

records.addlTxt: Request for Payment Plan, Agreement to Make Payments, and Order

1:51 PM Defendant Brendan S. Schauer in court.  Attorney Luke J Fischer Sr. in court for Brendan S. Schauer.  Attorney Kristi S. Tlusty in court for State of Wisconsin. Plea agreement recited into the record.  Attorney Tlusty moves to amend count 1 to ordinance of county disorderly conduct.  Plea of no contest.  Court orders a forfeiture in the amount of $263.50 plus $67.00 victim witness surcharge.  The bond of $150.00 shall be applied towards the costs with the balance being paid at the rate of $30.00 a month beginning October 18, 2022.
Plea hearing on October 17, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

3:00 PM Defendant Brendan S. Schauer appeared by video.  Attorney Luke J Fischer Sr. appeared by video for Brendan S. Schauer.  Attorney Kristi S. Tlusty in court for State of Wisconsin. Victim notification has been complied. Both parties are agreeing to set a date for a plea hearing. Hearing set for October 17, 2022 at 1:45p.m.-JN
Plea hearing scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
